description: Weapons Risk Mitigation and Mainstreaming Mine Action, Small Arms & Light Weapons Controls

subproject.description: This project aims to strengthen the Government (National Institute of Demining) capacity to meet with its obligations under the Anti-Personal Mine Ban Treaty by 2014 and deal with the residual issues involving mines and other Explosive Remnants from War. The project will support the demining activities through the International NGOs: APOPO, HALO Trust and Handicap International in order to accelerate demining operations using the district by district approach under the National Mine Action Plan (2008-2014).
subproject.title: Mainstreaming Mine Action

subproject.description: This project aims to strengthen the Government (National Institute of Demining) capacity to meet with its obligations under the Anti-Personal Mine Ban Treaty by 2014 and deal with the residual issues involving mines and other Explosive Remnants from War. The project will support the demining activities through the International NGOs: APOPO, HALO Trust and Handicap International in order to accelerate demining operations using the district by district approach under the National Mine Action Plan (2008-2014).
subproject.title: Mainstreaming Mine Action

subproject.description:
In order to foster citizens’ trust in the State, and thereby create an environment conducive to socio-economic development, Mozambique’s law enforcement authorities must be functioning, accountable, transparent, and professional forces. Building on the success of the UNDP “Performance, Professionalism, Pride” project implemented with the Polícia da República de Mozambique (PRM), this proposed project will support the development of law enforcement and military bodies’ capacity to provide effective Small Arms and Light Weapons (SALW) control of civilian and government owned weapons. This will not only reduce the perceived need of civilian firearms possession for protection, but also limit the ability of criminals to perpetrate armed crime without penalty. It will thus increase the population’s confidence in governmental capacity to enforce the law and the security of the population in terms of arms storage. 

The 2008-11 SALW MA integrated programme has been developed to support national and local capacities response to the challenges that stockpiled ammunitions, firearms and contamination from landmines and ERW continue to pose to Human Security and Human Development in Mozambique.  The SALW Programme will take place over three years and includes the following major outputs:

1.	Enhance government capacity to safely manage stockpiled munitions
2.	Enhance government capacity to meet its obligations under the AP Mine Ban Treaty and addresses residual threats posed by other ERW
3.	Enhance government capacity to manage and control firearms ownership
4.	UNDP delivers a coordinated response to the landmines, small arms and armed violence problems

The SALW Programme will be implemented through the National Execution (NEX) modality, involving a two implementing partners including: the Ministry of Interior (Police) and the Ministry of Defence as well as selected international and national NGOs.
subproject.title: Small Arms & Light Weapons Con

title: Weapons Risk Mitigation:Mine Action & Small Arms Control
